rules.natural: If the alchemist uses an alembic, then the alchemist creates gold.
Provided that the alchemist discovers the elixir, the alchemist creates gold.
Whenever the alchemist transforms lead, the alchemist creates gold.
In the event that the alchemist transforms mercury, the alchemist transforms lead.
The alchemist creates gold only if the alchemist transforms mercury.
Either the alchemist succeeds or, if the alchemist seeks the philosopher's stone, then the alchemist creates gold.
If the alchemist works with sulfur, then the alchemist works with salt.
The alchemist creates gold provided that the alchemist works with mercury.
Whenever the alchemist works with salt, the alchemist combines elements.
The alchemist works with mercury if the alchemist combines elements.
If the alchemist uses an athanor, then the alchemist creates gold.
The alchemist achieves transmutation whenever the alchemist uses prime matter.
The alchemist uses prime matter or the alchemist follows ancient texts.
Provided that the alchemist follows ancient texts, it is not the case that the alchemist fails.
If the alchemist abandons the quest, then the alchemist continues research.
Should the alchemist abandon the quest, it is not the case that the alchemist continues research.
Either the alchemist abandons the quest or the alchemist uses an alembic or the alchemist uses an athanor.
In the event that the alchemist works during the solstice, the alchemist uses an alembic or the alchemist uses an athanor.
The alchemist works during the solstice or the alchemist works during the equinox.
Provided that the alchemist works during the equinox, the alchemist works under planetary alignment.
If the alchemist observes celestial signs, then, if the alchemist works under planetary alignment, the alchemist uses an alembic or an athanor.
Either the alchemist observes celestial signs or the alchemist consults astrological charts.
The alchemist calculates an auspicious time provided that the alchemist consults astrological charts.
The alchemist uses an alembic if the alchemist has aqua vitae.
Whenever the alchemist calculates an auspicious time, then, if the alchemist works under planetary alignment, the alchemist uses an alembic or an athanor.
If the alchemist possesses a grimoire, then it is not the case that the alchemist obtains mandrake root.
The alchemist uses an athanor provided that the alchemist has aqua fortis.
If the alchemist understands the tria prima, then, if the alchemist works with sulfur, the alchemist works with mercury.
The alchemist understands the tria prima whenever the alchemist studies sulfur properties.
Either the alchemist studies sulfur properties or the alchemist studies mercury properties.
Provided that the alchemist studies mercury properties, the alchemist understands the tria prima.
If the alchemist comprehends the mercury principle, then, if the alchemist comprehends the sulfur principle, then, if the alchemist works with sulfur, the alchemist creates gold.
Provided that the alchemist works during the full moon, the alchemist uses fire.
Either the alchemist works during the full moon or the alchemist works during the new moon.
In the case that the alchemist works during the new moon, the alchemist has aqua vitae or the alchemist has aqua fortis.
The alchemist performs distillation whenever the alchemist uses fire.
Either the alchemist seeks the philosopher's stone or the alchemist discovers the elixir.
Should it not be the case that if the alchemist works during the full moon then the alchemist performs distillation, then the alchemist fails.
If it is not the case that if the alchemist seeks the philosopher's stone then the alchemist transforms lead, then the alchemist discovers a secret formula.
Provided that it is not the case that if the alchemist seeks the philosopher's stone then the alchemist transforms mercury, the alchemist masters calcination.
If it is not the case that if the alchemist seeks the philosopher's stone then the alchemist transforms mercury, then the alchemist masters sublimation.
If it is not the case that if the alchemist seeks the philosopher's stone then the alchemist creates gold, then it is not the case that the alchemist finds a rare herb.
